byline.original: By GINA KOLATA and SARAH COHEN

lead_paragraph: The rising death rates for young white adults, ages 25 to 34, make them the first generation since the Vietnam War years to experience higher death rates in early adulthood than the previous generation.

headline.print_headline: Drug Overdoses Propel Rise in Mortality Rates of Whites
headline.main: Drug Overdoses Propel Rise in Mortality Rates of Young Whites

snippet: The rising death rates for young white adults, ages 25 to 34, make them the first generation since the Vietnam War years to experience higher death rates in early adulthood than the previous generation.
abstract: Analysis of death certificates shows drug overdoses are driving up death rates of young white adults to levels higher than previous generations for first time since 1960s; numbers stand in stark contrast to lowering death rates for young black people and are erasing effects of medical advances for more traditional causes of death like heart disease.
